intro: Cestrum irazuense, commonly known as the Irazú nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a rough texture, while its fruit is a capsule containing numerous seeds. Cestrum irazuense is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
